member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.ReadOnlyList`1
member.summary: Fixed size array wrapped as IReadOnlyList{T} Construct with known size N, call Add N times, Freeze, and then use as IReadOnlyList{T} or IEnumerable{T}
member.remarks: Optimization for List list = new List{T}(); list.Add() list.Add() ...; list.TrimExcess(); list.AsReadOnly()

member.summary: Return an item

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.VirtualReadOnlyList`1
member.summary: Virtual IReadOnlyList + its enumerator
member.remarks:
Borrowed from the internal implementation of "yield return", IEnumerable and IEnumerator are implemented in the same class here, to save one extra allocation for the most common usage pattern of single enumerator in the same thread.
This class is used mostly by SingletonList. There are quite a few CCI objects which store single object inside by needs to return IEnumerable from it. This is used in super high frequency (e.g. BaseClasses) that we need to reduce memory allocation and CPU cost for it.
This solution is better replacement for GetSingletonEnumerable which just uses "yield return": 1) There only needs to be single implementation. 2) All the source code is here. 3) IReadOnlyList is implemented so caller can query for Count and this[index] without going through enumerator at all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.VirtualReadOnlyList`1.GetItem(System.Int32)
member.summary: One method to be implemented in derived classes

member.summary: Enumerator for IReadOnlyList

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.SingletonList`1
member.summary: IReadOnlyList wrapper for single item, + its enumerator (similar to yield return)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataCopier
member.summary: A class that produces a mutable deep copy a given metadata model node.
member.remarks:
The copy provided by this class is achieved in two phases. First, we define a mapping of cones by calling AddDefinition(A) for def-node(s) A(s) that is the root(s) of the cone. Then we call Substitute(A) for an A that is in the cone to get a copy of A.
The mapping is reflected in the cache, which is a mapping from object to objects. It has dual roles. The first is to define the new copies of the def-nodes in the cone. The second, which is to ensure isomorphism of the two graphs, will be discussed later.
The is populated for definitions in the setup phase either by the contructor or by a sequence of calls to AddDefinition(). After the return from the constructor (with a list of IDefinitions), or after the first Substitute method, the cone has been fixed. Further calls to addDefinitions will result in an ApplicationException.
[Substitute method] Given a cache c and a definition A, Substitute(c, A) returns a deep copy of A in which any node B is replaced by c(B). An exception is thrown if c(B) is not already defined.
If A is a reference, Substitute(c, A) return a copy of A in which all the references to a node B in the domain of c now point to c(B).
[Internal Working and Auxiliary Copy Functions] When AddDefinition(A) is called, a traverser is created to populate c with pairs (B, B') for sub def nodes of A, causing c changed to c1.
In the substitution phase, DeepCopy methods are used. For a def-node B, DeepCopy(c1, B) first tries to look up in the cache for B, then it calls GetMutableShallowCopy(B) on a cache miss. Either way, we get a mutable B', DeepCopy is performed recursively on the sub nodes of B' (which, should be B's subnodes at the moment). The fact that we are seeing B as a definition normally means that B must be in someone's cone. If B is not in c1's domain, an error must have been committed. A few exceptions are when a subnode contains a pointer to a parent def-node (but not a ref node), in which case GetMutableShallowCopyIfExists are used, because the parent is allowed to be outside the cone. Examples include a method body points to its method definition.
To deep copy a ref-node C, unless it is a short cut, a copy is made and its subnodes recursively deep copied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataCopier.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost)
member.summary: Create a copier with an empty mapping. The copier will maintain the isomorphism between the original and the copy.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataCopier.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,Microsoft.Cci.IDefinition,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition}@)
member.summary: Create a copier with a mapping betweem subdefinitions of rootOfCone and their new copy.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
An definition that defines one (of the possibly many) root of the cone.
Copies of the the type definitions in the cone under rootOfCone. This collection of type defs will be useful for the computation of all the types in the module.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataCopier.AddDefinition(Microsoft.Cci.IDefinition,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition}@)
member.summary: Given a root of cone as an IDefinition, call the right AddDefinition method according to the type of the root.
member.param: The root node of a cone, which we will copy later on.
Copies of the the old type definitions in the cone. This collection of type defs will be useful for the computation of all the types in the module.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.CollectAndShallowCopyDefinitions
member.summary: A helper class that makes copies of every definition that may be referenced before it will be encountered during a standard traversal. This excludes structural definitions that exist only as the result of resolving references to structural types. In other words, this makes early (and shallow) copies of fields, methods and types so that they can be referenced before being deep copied.
member.remarks: CollectAndShallowCopyDefinitions visits namespace and below. Assembly and module should be cached by the caller to make sure the right kind (assembly or module) is copied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.CollectAndShallowCopyDefinitions.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataCopier,System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition})
member.summary: A helper class that makes copies of every definition that may be referenced before it will be encountered during a standard traversal. This excludes structural definitions that exist only as the result of resolving references to structural types. In other words, this makes early (and shallow) copies of fields, methods and types so that they can be referenced before being deep copied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataExpression.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IStatement. The dispatch method does not invoke Dispatch on any child objects. If child traversal is desired, the implementations of the Visit methods should do the subsequent dispatching.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.EventDefinition
member.summary: An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This interface models the metadata representation of an event.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeDefinitionMember.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeDefinitionMember.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.summary: The compile time value of the field. This value should be used directly in IL, rather than a reference to the field. If the field does not have a valid compile time value, Dummy.Constant is returned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.FieldDefinition.CustomModifiers
member.summary: Custom modifiers associated with the referenced field. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.FieldDefinition.InternFactory

member.summary: A container for a list of IL instructions providing the implementation (if any) of this method.

member.summary: Calling convention of the signature.

member.summary: If the method is generic then this list contains the type parameters. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.GenericParameterCount
member.summary: The number of generic parameters of the method. Zero if the referenced method is not generic.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.HasDeclarativeSecurity
member.summary: True if this method has a non empty collection of SecurityAttributes or the System.Security.SuppressUnmanagedCodeSecurityAttribute.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.HasExplicitThisParameter
member.summary: True if this an instance method that explicitly declares the type and name of its first parameter (the instance).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.InternFactory
member.summary: A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns a key that is computed from the information in this reference and that distinguishes this.ResolvedMethod from all other methods obtained from the same metadata host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsAbstract
member.summary: True if the method does not provide an implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsAccessCheckedOnOverride
member.summary: True if the method can only be overridden when it is also accessible.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsAggressivelyInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is asked to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsCil
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in the CLI Common Intermediate Language.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsExternal
member.summary: True if the method has an external implementation (i.e. not supplied by this definition).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsForwardReference
member.summary: True if the method implementation is defined by another method definition (to be supplied at a later time).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsGeneric
member.summary: True if the method has generic parameters;

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsHiddenBySignature
member.summary: True if this method is hidden if a derived type declares a method with the same name and signature. If false, any method with the same name hides this method. This flag is ignored by the runtime and is only used by compilers.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsNativeCode
member.summary: True if the method is implemented in native (platform-specific) code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsNewSlot
member.summary: The method always gets a new slot in the virtual method table. This means the method will hide (not override) a base type method with the same name and signature.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsNeverInlined
member.summary: True if the the runtime is not allowed to inline this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsNeverOptimized
member.summary: True if the runtime is not allowed to optimize this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsPlatformInvoke
member.summary: True if the method is implemented via the invocation of an underlying platform method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeImplemented
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is supplied by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeInternal
member.summary: True if the method is an internal part of the runtime and must be called in a special way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsRuntimeSpecial
member.summary: True if the method gets special treatment from the runtime. For example, it might be a constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsSealed
member.summary: True if the method may not be overridden.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsSpecialName
member.summary: True if the method is special in some way for tools. For example, it might be a property getter or setter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsStatic
member.summary: True if the method does not require an instance of its declaring type as its first argument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsStaticConstructor
member.summary: True if the method is a static constructor.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsSynchronized
member.summary: True if only one thread at a time may execute this method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsUnmanaged
member.summary: True if the implementation of this method is not managed by the runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.IsVirtual
member.summary: True if the method may be overridden (or if it is an override).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.Parameters
member.summary: The parameters forming part of this signature. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ParameterCount
member.summary: The number of required parameters of the method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.PlatformInvokeData
member.summary: Detailed information about the PInvoke stub. Identifies which method to call, which module has the method and the calling convention among other things.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.PreserveSignature
member.summary: True if the method signature must not be mangled during the interoperation with COM code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.RequiresSecurityObject
member.summary: True if the method calls another method containing security code. If this flag is set, the method should have System.Security.DynamicSecurityMethodAttribute present in its list of custom attributes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueAttributes
member.summary: Custom attributes associated with the method's return value.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueCustomModifiers
member.summary: Returns the list of custom modifiers, if any, associated with the returned value. Evaluate this property only if ReturnValueIsModified is true. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsByRef
member.summary: True if the return value is passed by reference (using a managed pointer).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsMarshalledExplicitly
member.summary: The return value has associated marshalling information.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueIsModified
member.summary: True if the return value has one or more custom modifiers associated with it.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueMarshallingInformation
member.summary: Specifies how the return value is marshalled when the method is called from unmanaged code.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ReturnValueName
member.summary: Specifies the name of the return value parameter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: Declarative security actions for this method. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.Type
member.summary: The return type of the method or type of the property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodDefinition.ResolvedMethod
member.summary: The method being referred to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.NamedTypeDefinition.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.NamedTypeDefinition.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedEventDefinition
member.summary: An event defined inside a generic type instance or inside a specialized nested type. An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedEventDefinition.#ctor
member.summary: An event defined inside a generic type instance or inside a specialized nested type. An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedEventDefinition.Copy(Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedEventDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of a specialized event. An event is a member that enables an object or class to provide notifications. Clients can attach executable code for events by supplying event handlers. This interface models the metadata representation of an event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedEventDefinition.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: The event that has been specialized to obtain this event. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldDefinition
member.summary: A field defined inside a generic type instance or inside a specialized nested type. A field is a member that represents a variable associated with an object or class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldDefinition.#ctor
member.summary: A field is a member that represents a variable associated with an object or class. This interface models the metadata representation of a field.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldDefinition.Copy(Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedFieldDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of a specialized field. A field is a member that represents a variable associated with an object or class. This interface models the metadata representation of a field.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldDefinition.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: The field that has been specialized to obtain this field. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(ISpecializedFieldReference).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedFieldReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the field definition that has been specialized to obtain the field definition referred to by this field reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized field definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized field reference refers to the corresponding field definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized field reference always refers to a field definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedMethodDefinition
member.summary: A method defined inside a generic type instance or inside a specialized nested type.

member.summary: A method defined inside a generic type instance or inside a specialized nested type.

member.summary: Makes a shallow copy of a specialized method.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedMethodDefinition.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: The method that has been specialized to obtain this method. When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. (I.e. the unspecialized member always corresponds to a definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedMethodReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(ISpecializedMethodReference).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedMethodReference.UnspecializedVersion
member.summary: A reference to the method definition that has been specialized to obtain the method definition referred to by this method reference. When the containing type of the referenced specialized method definition is itself a specialized nested type of a generic type instance, then the unspecialized method reference refers to the corresponding method definition from the unspecialized containing type definition. (I.e. the unspecialized method reference always refers to a method definition that is not obtained via specialization.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation
member.summary: Information about how values of managed types should be marshalled to and from unmanaged types.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.#ctor
member.summary: Allocates an object containig information about how values of managed types should be marshalled to and from unmanaged types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.CustomMarshaller
member.summary: A reference to the type implementing the custom marshaller.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.CustomMarshallerRuntimeArgument
member.summary: An argument string (cookie) passed to the custom marshaller at run time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.ElementType
member.summary: The unmanged element type of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.IidParameterIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of the parameter that contains the value of the Inteface Identifier (IID) of the marshalled object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.UnmanagedType
member.summary: The unmanaged type to which the managed type will be marshalled. This can be be UnmanagedType.CustomMarshaler, in which case the unmanaged type is decided at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.NumberOfElements
member.summary: The number of elements in the fixed size portion of the unmanaged array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.ParamIndex
member.summary: The zero based index of the parameter in the unmanaged method that contains the number of elements in the variable portion of unmanaged array. If the index is null, the variable portion is of size zero, or the caller conveys the size of the variable portion of the array to the unmanaged method in some other way.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementSubtype
member.summary: The type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. See also SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The "sub type" specifies the value of all of the tag fields (vt) of the element values. )

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MarshallingInformation.SafeArrayElementUserDefinedSubtype
member.summary: A reference to the user defined type to which the variant values of all elements of the safe array must belong. (The element type of a safe array is VARIANT. The tag fields will all be either VT_DISPATCH or VT_UNKNOWN or VT_RECORD. The "user defined sub type" specifies the type of value the ppdispVal/ppunkVal/pvRecord fields of the element values may point to.)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection
member.summary: A section of the PE file that does not contain any objects that can be referenced in another way using this object model. The data of such a section is not decompiled by metadata reader and is written out unchanged by metadata writers. Presumably it is meaningful in some way and is thus exposed for use by other tools.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.#ctor
member.summary: A section of the PE file that does not contain any objects that can be referenced in another way using this object model. The data of such a section is not decompiled by metadata reader and is written out unchanged by metadata writers. Presumably it is meaningful in some way and is thus exposed for use by other tools.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.SectionName
member.summary: The name of the section. Should be exactly eight characters long.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.Characteristics
member.summary: A set of bits that describes the purpose of a section and how it behaves when loaded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.VirtualAddress
member.summary: For executable images this is the address of the first byte of the section, when loaded into memory, relative to the image base.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.VirtualSize
member.summary: Total size of the section in bytes. If this value is greater than SizeOfRawData, the section is zero-padded.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.SizeOfRawData
member.summary: Size of the initialized data on disk in bytes, shall be a multiple of FileAlignment from the PE header. If this is less than VirtualSize the remainder of the section is zero filled. Because this field is rounded while the VirtualSize field is not, it is possible for this to be greater than VirtualSize. When a section contains only uninitialized data, this field should be 0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.PESection.Rawdata
member.summary: The data, if any, with which the section will be initialized when loaded. May be null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SecurityAttribute

member.summary: Allocates a declarative specification of a security action applied to a set of permissions. Used by the CLR loader to enforce security restrictions.

member.summary: Specifies the security action that can be performed using declarative security. For example the action could be Deny.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SecurityAttribute.Attributes
member.summary: Custom attributes that collectively define the permission set to which the action is applied. Each attribute represents a serialized permission or permission set. The union of the sets, together with the individual permissions, define the set to which the action applies.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyDocument
member.summary: Mutable equivalent to Microsoft.Cci.MetadataReader.MethodBodyDocument. The main difference is that the MethodToken does not necessarily correspond to the mutable model (as tokens are not available yet). Instead, it is something that should be understood by the PdbReader that is carried along with this MethodBodyDocument.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyDocument.Location
member.summary: The location where this document was found, or where it should be stored. This will also uniquely identify the source document within an instance of compilation host.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyDocument.Name
member.summary: The name of the document. For example the name of the file if the document corresponds to a file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyDocument.MethodToken
member.summary: Token used to find information about the method in the PDB.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyDocument.TokenDecoder
member.summary: Returns a token decoder for the method associated with this document.

member.summary: The document containing this method whose body contains this location.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodBodyLocation.MethodDefinition

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter
member.summary: A class that traverses a metadata model in depth first, left to right order, rewriting each mutable node it visits by updating the node's children with recursivly rewritten nodes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A class that traverses a metadata model in depth first, left to right order, rewriting each mutable node it visits by updating the node's children with recursivly rewritten nodes.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this rewriter. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
If true, the rewriter replace frozen or immutable references with shallow copies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.host
member.summary: An object representing the application that is hosting this rewriter. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.referenceRewrites
member.summary: A map from reference to rewritten reference. Can be used to avoid rewriting the same reference more than once.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IAliasForType)
member.summary: Rewrites the alias for type

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IAliasMember)
member.summary: Rewrites the alias for type member.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IArrayTypeReference)
member.summary: Rewrites the array type reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IAssembly)
member.summary: Rewrites the given assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IAssemblyReference)
member.summary: Rewrites the given assembly reference.

member.summary: Rewrites the given custom attribute.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.ICustomModifier)
member.summary: Rewrites the given custom modifier.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataRewriter.Rewrite(Microsoft.Cci.IEventDefinition)
member.summary: Rewrites the given event definition.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator
member.summary: This class is obsolete because it is too hard to use correctly. Please use MutatingVisitor and MetadataCopier instead. A visitor that produces a mutable copy a given metadata model. Derived classes can override the visit methods to intervene in the copying process, usually resulting in a copy that is not equivalent to the original model. For instance, the new copy might have additional types and methods, or additional calls to instrumentation routines.
member.remarks: While the model is being copied, the resulting model is incomplete and or inconsistent. It should not be traversed independently nor should any of its computed properties, such as ResolvedType be evaluated. Scenarios that need such functionality should be implemented by first making a mutable copy of the entire assembly and then running a second pass over the mutable result. The new classes MetadataDeepCopier and MetadataRewriter are meant to facilitate such scenarios.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost)
member.summary: Allocates a visitor that produces a mutable copy a given metadata model. Derived classes can override the visit methods to intervene in the copying process, usually resulting in a copy that is not equivalent to the original model. For instance, the new copy might have additional types and methods, or additional calls to instrumentation routines.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates a visitor that produces a mutable copy a given metadata model. Derived classes can override the visit methods to intervene in the copying process, usually resulting in a copy that is not equivalent to the original model. For instance, the new copy might have additional types and methods, or additional calls to instrumentation routines.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
True if the mutator should try and perform mutations in place, rather than mutating new copies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.cache
member.summary: Duplicates are cached, both to save space and to detect when the traversal of a cycle should stop.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.copyOnlyIfNotAlreadyMutable
member.summary: True if the mutator should try and perform mutations in place, rather than mutating new copies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.referenceCache
member.summary: Since definitions are also references, it can happen that a definition is visited as both a definition and as a reference. If so, the cache may contain a duplicated definition when a reference is expected, or vice versa. To prevent this, reference duplicates are always cached separately.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.TypeOrderPreserver
member.summary: A callback object provided to the sort routine to allow it to compare INamedTypeDefinition objects. The criteria used for the comparison is that if type x was before type y in the assembly of which a mutated copy is being constructed, then type x should remain before type y in the mutated copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.TypeOrderPreserver.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition})
member.summary: A callback object provided to the sort routine to allow it to compare INamedTypeDefinition objects. The criteria used for the comparison is that if type x was before type y in the assembly of which a mutated copy is being constructed, then type x should remain before type y in the mutated copy.
member.param: The list of types in assembly of which a mutated copy is being constructed. This implicitly specifies an ordering for the (preserved) types in the mutated copy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MetadataMutator.TypeOrderPreserver.Compare(Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition,Microsoft.Cci.INamedTypeDefinition)
member.summary: Performs a comparison of two INamedTypeDefinition instances and returns a value indicating whether one object is less than, equal to, or greater than the other. The criteria used for the comparison is that if type x was before type y in the assembly of which a mutated copy is being constructed, then type x should remain before type y in the mutated copy.
member.param: The first INamedTypeDefinition instance to compare.
The second INamedTypeDefinition instance to compare.
member.returns: Value Condition Less than zero is less than .Zero equals .Greater than zero is greater than .

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor
member.summary: A visitor that visits a mutable metadata model. Derived classes can override the Mutate() methods to intervene in the visiting process, usually changes subnodes in place. Definitions that are used as refereces are visited as references. Because references may be shared between parts that are visited and parts that are not, this visitor may make a copy of a reference. The same references will be replaced by this copy whenever seen by the visitor.
member.remarks: 1) When making copies, for type references, copies are made only when any of the subnodes changed. This optimization is not available for method, fields, namespace and other references. 2) Subclasses, if want to change a node, override the Mutate method. For ITypeReference, IAssemblyReference and their subclasses, Mutate takes an interface value as argument. Otherwise, Mutate method mutates a mutable model object. 3) References are identified by their object ID in this class. A better alternative could use interned ID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost)
member.summary: A visitor that visits a mutable metadata model. Derived classes can override the visit methods to intervene in the visiting process, usually changes subnodes in place. By default this visitor will not visit non-mutable model nodes. This behavior can be changed by setting the visitImmutableNodes flag to be true.
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.#ctor(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataHost,System.Boolean)
member.summary: A visitor that visits a mutable metadata model. Derived classes can override the visit methods to intervene in the visiting process, usually changes subnodes in place. By default this visitor will not visit non-mutable model nodes. This behavior can be changed by setting the visitImmutableNodes flag to be true;
member.param: An object representing the application that is hosting this mutator. It is used to obtain access to some global objects and services such as the shared name table and the table for interning references.
When we see an immutable node, whether we descend to visit its children.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.visitImmutableNodes
member.summary: True if the mutator should try and perform mutations in place, rather than mutating new copies.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.host
member.summary: The metadata host.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.path
member.summary: The path that starts from the root of the cone, containing every container node that enclosing the node that is currently visited.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.stopTraversal
member.summary: Set this flag to stop further traversing.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.referenceCache
member.summary: A cache for references, which may be copied. There is one copy for an original reference ref; the cache always contains (ref, copy) and (copy, copy) for every reference that has been copied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.GetCurrentMethod
member.summary: If we haven't finished visiting a method definition, returns that method. Otherwise, returns dummy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.GetCurrentNamespace
member.summary: If we havent finished visiting a namespace, returns the most recent such a namespace. Otherwise, returns dummy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.GetCurrentSignature
member.summary: If we havent finished visiting a signature, returns that signature. Otherwise, returns dummy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.GetCurrentType
member.summary: If we havent finished visiting a type, returns the most recent such a type. Otherwise, returns dummy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.GetCurrentUnit
member.summary: If we havent finished visiting a unit, returns that unit. Otherwise, returns dummy.

member.summary: Visits (interface)IFieldDefinition. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Visit(Microsoft.Cci.IFieldReference)
member.summary:
Visits an (interface) field reference. We first see the reference has been cached. If so we return the cached value. Then we mutate a copy of the input as a reference, if the input is a definition or already a mutable reference. If the copy is an immutable, non short-cut reference, we may choose to visit its subnodes according to the flag this.visitImmutableNodes.
Note that mutable nodes that implement the IFieldReference include those implement ISpecializedFieldReference ( that is SpecializedFieldReference and SpecializedFieldDefinition), IGlobalFieldDefinition(GlobalFieldDefinition) and IFieldDefinition(excluding IGlobalFieldDefinitions, that is, only FieldDefinition).

member.summary: Visits the specified field reference.

member.summary: Visits an (interface) global method definition. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Visit(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodBody)
member.summary: Visits an (interface) method body. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Visit(Microsoft.Cci.IMethodReference)
member.summary:
Visits an (interface) method reference. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).
Note that mutable nodes that implement IMethodReference include those who implement ISpecializedMethodReference (SpecializedMethodDefinition and SpecializedMethodReference), who implements IGenericMethodInstanceReference(GenericMethodInstance and GenericMethodInstanceReference), who implements IGlobalMethodDefinition (GlobalMethodDefinition), who implements IMethodDefinition otherwise( MethodDefinition) and MethodReference. For definition nodes, we have to visit them as reference nodes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Mutate(Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MethodReference)
member.summary: Visits a mutable method reference.

member.summary: Visit an interface module. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes). We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. member.summary:
Visits the interface ISpecializedFieldReference. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).
Note that mutable nodes that implement ISpecializedFieldReference include SpecializedFieldReference and SpecializedFieldDefinition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Visit(Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedMethodReference)
member.summary:
Visits an (interface) ISpecializedMethodReference. We first see if it is a mutable model node, if so, we call the visit method on the mutable node. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, depending on the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).
Note that mutable nodes that implement ISpecializedMethodReference include SpecializedMethodReference and SpecializedMethodDefinition.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Mutate(Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.SpecializedMethodReference)
member.summary: Visits a mutable specialized method reference.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Visit(Microsoft.Cci.ISpecializedNestedTypeReference)
member.summary:
Visits an (interface) ISpecializedNestedTypeReference node. We first check in the cache and return the cached value if there is one. Then we call the Mutate method where a copy may be produced if anything changes. If not, we either return, or continue to visit the immutable subnodes, according to the flag (this.visitImmutableNodes).
If a subclass want to change the node, override the corresponding Mutate method.
Note that mutable nodes that implement ISpecializedNestedTypeReference include SpecializedNestedTypeReference and SpecializedNestedTypeDefinition.

member.summary:
Visits the specified namespace type reference. We first check in the cache and return the cached value if there is one. Then we call the Substitute method where a copy may be produced if anything changes.
If a subclass want to change the node, override the corresponding Substitute method.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MutatingVisitor.Mutate(Microsoft.Cci.INamespaceTypeReference)
member.summary:
Creates a new copy of the reference node only if any its sub nodes are changed during recursive visit. Returns the input reference otherwise.
Override this method in the subclass if changes to this node are planned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitNamespace.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitNamespace.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference
member.summary: A reference to a type. Type references can be initialized incrementally, but once a reference is frozen, or resolved or once the InternedKey of a reference has been computed, no further initialization is permitted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.#ctor
member.summary: A reference to a type. Type references can be initialized incrementally, but once a reference is frozen, or resolved or once the InternedKey of a reference has been computed, no further initialization is permitted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.Copy(Microsoft.Cci.ITypeReference,Microsoft.Cci.IInternFactory)
member.summary: Makes this reference be a shallow copy of the given type reference.
member.param: The type referenced to shallow copy onto this reference.

A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.isFrozen
member.summary: True if the reference has been frozen and can no longer be modified. A reference becomes frozen as soon as it is resolved or interned. An unfrozen reference can also explicitly be set to be frozen. It is recommended that any code constructing a type reference freezes it immediately after construction is complete.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the current .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.AliasForType
member.summary: If this type reference can be resolved and it resolves to a type alias, the resolution continues on to resolve the reference to the aliased type. This property provides a way to discover how that resolution proceeded, by exposing the alias concerned. Think of this as a version of ResolvedType that does not traverse aliases.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.InternFactory
member.summary: A collection of methods that associate unique integers with metadata model entities. The association is based on the identities of the entities and the factory does not retain references to the given metadata model objects.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.InternedKey
member.summary: Returns the unique interned key associated with the type. This takes unification/aliases/custom modifiers into account.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.IsAlias
member.summary: Indicates if this type reference resolved to an alias rather than a type

ensures.vb: result Implies Not Me Is Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.IsEnum
member.summary: True if the type is an enumeration (it extends System.Enum and is sealed). Corresponds to C# enum.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.IsFrozen
member.summary: True if the reference has been frozen and can no longer be modified. A reference becomes frozen as soon as it is resolved or interned. An unfrozen reference can also explicitly be set to be frozen. It is recommended that any code constructing a type reference freezes it immediately after construction is complete.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.IsValueType
member.summary: True if the type is a value type. Value types are sealed and extend System.ValueType or System.Enum. A type parameter for which MustBeValueType (the struct constraint in C#) is true also returns true for this property.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.ResolvedType
member.summary: The type definition being referred to. In case this type was alias, this is also the type of the aliased type. If the type reference cannot be resolved, the result is Dummy.TypeDefinition.

ensures.vb: Me Is Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition Implies result = Me

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.Locations
member.summary: A potentially null, potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.PlatformType
member.summary: A way to get to platform types such as System.Object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.TypeReference.TypeCode
member.summary: Unless the value of TypeCode is PrimitiveTypeCode.NotPrimitive, the type corresponds to a "primitive" CLR type (such as System.Int32) and the type code identifies which of the primitive types it corresponds to.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.#ctor
member.summary: A reference to an array type. Type references can be initialized incrementally, but once a reference is frozen, or resolved or once the InternedKey of a reference has been computed, no further initialization is permitted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.Resolve
member.summary: Returns the type of the resolved array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.ElementType
member.summary: The type of the elements of this array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.IsVector
member.summary: This type of array is a single dimensional array with zero lower bound for index values.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.LowerBounds
member.summary: A possibly empty list of lower bounds for dimension indices. When not explicitly specified, a lower bound defaults to zero. The first lower bound in the list corresponds to the first dimension. Dimensions cannot be skipped. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.Rank
member.summary: The number of array dimensions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.Sizes
member.summary: A possible empty list of upper bounds for dimension indices. The first upper bound in the list corresponds to the first dimension. Dimensions cannot be skipped. An unspecified upper bound means that instances of this type can have an arbitrary upper bound for that dimension. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.ResolvedType
member.summary: Gets the type of the resolved.

ensures.vb: Me Is Microsoft.Cci.ITypeDefinition Implies result = Me

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ArrayTypeReference.ResolvedArrayType
member.summary: Gets the type of the resolved array.
member.value: The type of the resolved array.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.CustomModifier.Modifier

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MatrixTypeReference.LowerBounds
member.summary: A possible empty list of lower bounds for dimension indices. When not explicitly specified, a lower bound defaults to zero. The first lower bound in the list corresponds to the first dimension. Dimensions cannot be skipped. May be null.

member.summary: The number of array dimensions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.MatrixTypeReference.Sizes
member.summary: A possible empty list of upper bounds for dimension indices. The first upper bound in the list corresponds to the first dimension. Dimensions cannot be skipped. An unspecified upper bound means that instances of this type can have an arbitrary upper bound for that dimension. May be null.

When the containing type is an instance of type which is itself a specialized member (i.e. it is a nested type of a generic type instance), then the unspecialized member refers to a member from the unspecialized containing type. member.name: T:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly
member.summary: Represents a .NET assembly.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference. The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls the visitor.Visit(T) method where T is the most derived object model node interface type implemented by the concrete type of the object implementing IReference, which is not derived from IDefinition. For example an object implemeting IArrayType will call visitor.Visit(IArrayTypeReference) and not visitor.Visit(IArrayType). The dispatch method does nothing else.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.isFrozen
member.summary: True if the reference has been frozen and can no longer be modified. A reference becomes frozen as soon as it is resolved or interned. An unfrozen reference can also explicitly be set to be frozen. It is recommended that any code constructing a type reference freezes it immediately after construction is complete.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of metadata custom attributes that are associated with this definition. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.IsFrozen
member.summary: True if the reference has been frozen and can no longer be modified. A reference becomes frozen as soon as it is resolved or interned. An unfrozen reference can also explicitly be set to be frozen. It is recommended that any code constructing a type reference freezes it immediately after construction is complete.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.Locations
member.summary: A potentially empty collection of locations that correspond to this instance. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.Name
member.summary: The name of the referenced unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.ResolvedUnit
member.summary: The referenced unit, or Dummy.Unit if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.UnitReference.UnitIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the unit reference.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.ContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly corresponding to the target platform contract assembly at the time this unit was compiled. This property will be used to implement IMetadataHost.ContractAssemblySymbolicIdentity and its implementation must consequently not use the latter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the assembly corresponding to the target platform core assembly at the time this unit was compiled. This property will be used to implement IMetadataHost.CoreAssemblySymbolicIdentity and its implementation must consequently not use the latter.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.Location
member.summary: An indication of the location where the unit is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.UninterpretedSections
member.summary: A sequence of PE sections that are not well known to PE readers and thus have not been decompiled into other parts of the Metadata Model. These sections may have meaning to other tools. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.PlatformType
member.summary: A collection of well known types that must be part of every target platform and that are fundamental to modeling compiled code. The types are obtained by querying the unit set of the compilation and thus can include types that are defined by the compilation itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.UnitNamespaceRoot
member.summary: A root namespace that contains nested namespaces as well as top level types and anything else that implements INamespaceMember.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.UnitReferences
member.summary: A list of other units that are referenced by this unit.

ensures.csharp: for all x in result x != null
ensures.vb: for all x in result x <> Nothing

getter.ensures: for all x in result x != null

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Unit.NamespaceRoot
member.summary: The associated root namespace.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IModule).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IModuleReference).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.AllTypes
member.summary: Gets or sets all types.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.AssemblyReferences
member.summary: A list of the assemblies that are referenced by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.BaseAddress
member.summary: The preferred memory address at which the module is to be loaded at runtime.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The Assembly that contains this module. If this module is main module then this returns this. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.DebugInformationLocation
member.summary: A path to the debug information corresponding to this module. Can be absolute or relative to the file path of the module. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.DebugInformationVersion
member.summary: A hexadecimal string that is used to store and retrieve the debugging symbols from a symbol store.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.DllCharacteristics
member.summary: Flags that control the behavior of the target operating system. CLI implementations are supposed to ignore this, but some operating system pay attention.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.EntryPoint
member.summary: The method that will be called to start execution of this executable module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.FileAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of sections in the module's image file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.GenericMethodInstances
member.summary: A usually empty (null) collection of generic method instances that are directly or indirectly used by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ILOnly
member.summary: True if the module contains only IL and is processor independent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.StrongNameSigned
member.summary: True if the module contains a hash of its contents, encrypted with the private key of an assembly strong name.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.StructuralTypeInstances
member.summary: A usually empty (null) collection of structural type instances that are directly or indirectly used by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.StructuralTypeInstanceMembers
member.summary: A usually empty (null) collection of structural type instance members that are directly or indirectly used by this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Prefers32bits
member.summary: If set, the module is platform independent but prefers to be loaded in a 32-bit process for performance reasons.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Kind
member.summary: The kind of metadata stored in this module. For example whether this module is an executable or a manifest resource file.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.LinkerMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 8 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.LinkerMinorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the linker that produced this module. For example, the 0 in 8.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Location
member.summary: An indication of the location where the assembly is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.MetadataFormatMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 1 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.MetadataFormatMinorVersion
member.summary: The second part of a two part version number indicating the version of the format used to persist this module. For example, the 0 in 1.0.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ModuleAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this module. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ModuleReferences
member.summary: A list of the modules that are referenced by this module. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Name
member.summary: The name of the module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.PersistentIdentifier
member.summary: A globally unique persistent identifier for this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Machine
member.summary: Specifies the target CPU.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.RequiresAmdInstructionSet
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions or assumptions that are specific to the AMD 64 bit instruction set. Setting this flag to true also sets Requires64bits to true.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.RequiresStartupStub
member.summary: If set, the module must include a machine code stub that transfers control to the virtual execution system.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Requires32bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 32 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 32 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Requires64bits
member.summary: If set, the module contains instructions that assume a 64 bit instruction set. For example it may depend on an address being 64 bits. This may be true even if the module contains only IL instructions because of PlatformInvoke and COM interop.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SizeOfHeapCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SizeOfHeapReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial process heap.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SizeOfStackCommit
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory initially committed for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SizeOfStackReserve
member.summary: The size of the virtual memory to reserve for the initial thread's stack.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Strings
member.summary: Gets or sets the strings. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SubsystemMajorVersion
member.summary: The first part of a two part version number indicating the operating subsystem that is expected to be the target environment for this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.SubsystemMinorVersion
member.summary: The second part of a two part version number indicating the operating subsystem that is expected to be the target environment for this module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.TargetRuntimeVersion
member.summary: Identifies the version of the CLR that is required to load this module or assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.TrackDebugData
member.summary: True if the instructions in this module must be compiled in such a way that the debugging experience is not compromised. To set the value of this property, add an instance of System.Diagnostics.DebuggableAttribute to the MetadataAttributes list.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.TypeReferences
member.summary: Zero or more type references used in the module. May be null. If the module is produced by reading in a CLR PE file, then this will be the contents of the type reference table. If the module is produced some other way, the method may return an empty enumeration or an enumeration that is a subset of the type references actually used in the module. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.TypeMemberReferences
member.summary: Returns zero or more type member references used in the module. May be null. If the module is produced by reading in a CLR PE file, then this will be the contents of the member reference table (which only contains entries for fields and methods). If the module is produced some other way, the method may return an empty enumeration or an enumeration that is a subset of the member references actually used in the module. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.UnitReferences
member.summary: A list of other units that are referenced by this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.UsePublicKeyTokensForAssemblyReferences
member.summary: True if the module will be persisted with a list of assembly references that include only tokens derived from the public keys of the referenced assemblies, rather than with references that include the full public keys of referenced assemblies as well as hashes over the contents of the referenced assemblies. Setting this property to true is appropriate during development. When building for deployment it is safer to set this property to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.Win32Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the module and used during execution, typically via the Win32 API. A module will define Win32 resources rather than "managed" resources mainly to present metadata to legacy tools and not typically use the data in its own code. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.UnitIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the unit reference.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the referenced module.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ResolvedModule
member.summary: The referenced module, or Dummy.Module if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Module.ResolvedUnit
member.summary: The referenced unit, or Dummy.Unit if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Dispatch(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IAssembly).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.DispatchAsReference(Microsoft.Cci.IMetadataVisitor)
member.summary: Calls visitor.Visit(IAssemblyReference).

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.AssemblyAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of types that extend System.Attribute. Provides an extensible way to associate metadata with this assembly. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.ContainingAssembly
member.summary: The Assembly that contains this module. If this module is main module then this returns this. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Culture
member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.ExportedTypes
member.summary: Public types defined in other modules making up this assembly and to which other assemblies may refer to via this assembly. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Flags
member.summary: A set of bits and bit ranges representing properties of the assembly. The value of can be set from source code via the AssemblyFlags assembly custom attribute. The interpretation of the property depends on the target platform.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Files
member.summary: A list of the files that constitute the assembly. These are not the source language files that may have been used to compile the assembly, but the files that contain constituent modules of a multi-module assembly as well as any external resources. It corresonds to the File table of the .NET assembly file format. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.ContainsForeignTypes
member.summary: True if the referenced assembly contains types that describe objects that are neither COM objects nor objects that are managed by the CLR. Instances of such types are created and managed by another runtime and are accessed by CLR objects via some form of interoperation mechanism.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Location
member.summary: An indication of the location where the assembly is or will be stored. This need not be a file system path and may be empty. The interpretation depends on the ICompilationHostEnviroment instance used to resolve references to this unit.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.MemberModules
member.summary: A list of the modules that constitute the assembly. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.ModuleName
member.summary: The name of the module containing the assembly manifest. This can be different from the name of the assembly itself.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: Gets the module identity.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Name
member.summary: The name of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of this assembly. Null if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt HashValue which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value to verify the integrity of the assembly. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Resources
member.summary: A list of named byte sequences persisted with the assembly and used during execution, typically via .NET Framework helper classes. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.SecurityAttributes
member.summary: A list of objects representing persisted instances of pairs of security actions and sets of security permissions. These apply by default to every method reachable from the module. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Version
member.summary: The version of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.AssemblyIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the referenced assembly.
member.remarks: The location might be empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.UnifiedAssemblyIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the assembly reference to which this assembly reference has been unified.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.Assembly.Aliases
member.summary: A list of aliases for the root namespace of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ModuleReference.ContainingAssembly

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ModuleReference.Host
member.summary: An object representing the application that is hosting the object model that this reference forms a part of. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ModuleReference.ModuleIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the referenced module.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.ModuleReference.ReferringUnit
member.summary: The unit that is the root of a graph that contains this reference instance. This is not the same as ContainingAssembly, which is a reference to the assembly that contains the module which is referenced by this instance. May be null.

member.summary: The referenced module, or Dummy.Module if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.summary: The referenced unit, or Dummy.Unit if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.summary: Tries to resolves the reference with the aid of this.Host. If resolution fails, the result is Dummy.Module.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.Aliases
member.summary: A list of aliases for the root namespace of the referenced assembly. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.ResolvedAssembly
member.summary: The referenced assembly, or Dummy.Assembly if the reference cannot be resolved.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.Culture
member.summary: Identifies the culture associated with the assembly reference. Typically specified for sattelite assemblies with localized resources. Empty if not specified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.IsRetargetable
member.summary: True if the implementation of the referenced assembly used at runtime is not expected to match the version seen at compile time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.ContainsForeignTypes
member.summary: True if the referenced assembly contains types that describe objects that are neither COM objects nor objects that are managed by the CLR. Instances of such types are created and managed by another runtime and are accessed by CLR objects via some form of interoperation mechanism.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.HashValue
member.summary: The encrypted SHA1 hash of the persisted form of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.PublicKey
member.summary: The public part of the key used to encrypt the SHA1 hash over the persisted form of the referenced assembly. Null if not specified. This value is used by the loader to decrypt HashValue which it then compares with a freshly computed hash value to verify the integrity of the assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.PublicKeyToken
member.summary: The hashed 8 bytes of the public key of the referenced assembly. This is empty if the referenced assembly does not have a public key. May be null.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.Version
member.summary: The version of the assembly reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.Location
member.summary: The location of the referenced assembly.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.AssemblyIdentity
member.summary: The identity of the referenced assembly. Has the same Culture, Name, PublicKeyToken and Version as the reference.
member.remarks: Also has a location, which may might be empty. Although mostly redundant, the object returned by this property is useful because it derives from System.Object and therefore can be used as a hash table key. It may be more efficient to use the properties defined directly on the reference, since the object returned by this property may be allocated lazily and the allocation can thus be avoided by using the reference's properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Cci.MutableCodeModel.AssemblyReference.UnifiedAssemblyIdentity
member.summary: Returns the identity of the assembly reference to which this assembly reference has been unified.
member.remarks: The location might not be set.
